SEARCH
Package my.uum

Class Scheduler

java.lang.Object
my.uum.Scheduler
public class Scheduler extends Object
The Scheduler class represents a scheduler that uses the Round Robin algorithm. It manages the execution of processes.

  • Constructor Details

    • Scheduler

      public Scheduler(int numOfProcess, int quantumNum, String[] processID, int[] burstTime, int[] arrivalTime)
      Initializes a Scheduler object with the specified parameters.
      Parameters:
      numOfProcess - The total number of processes.
      quantumNum - The time quantum for the Round Robin scheduling algorithm.
      processID - An array containing the process IDs.
      burstTime - An array containing the burst times for each process.
      arrivalTime - An array containing the arrival times for each process.

  • Method Details

    • runScheduler

      public void runScheduler()
      This method is to run the Round Robin scheduling algorithm for a set of processes.

    • queueUpdation

      public void queueUpdation(int[] queue, int timer, int[] arrival, int numOfProcess, int maxProccessIndex)
      This method is to update the process queue based on the arrival of new processes.
      Parameters:
      queue - The array representing the process queue.
      timer - The current timer value.
      arrival - The array containing arrival times of processes.
      numOfProcess - The total number of processes.
      maxProccessIndex - The index of the process with the maximum arrival time.

    • checkNewArrival

      public void checkNewArrival(int timer, int[] arrival, int numOfProcess, int maxProccessIndex, int[] queue)
      This method is to check for the arrival of new processes and updates the process queue accordingly.
      Parameters:
      timer - Current time in the scheduling algorithm.
      arrival - Array containing arrival times of processes.
      numOfProcess - Total number of processes in the system.
      maxProccessIndex - Index of the last processed or scheduled process.
      queue - Array representing the process queue.

    • queueMaintainence

      public void queueMaintainence(int[] queue, int numOfProcess)
      This method is to maintain the integrity of the process queue by shifting elements to the left.
      Parameters:
      queue - Array representing the process queue.
      numOfProcess - Total number of processes in the system.

    • getCompleteTime

      public int[] getCompleteTime()

    • getStartTime

      public int[] getStartTime()
      This method is to retrieve the array containing the start times for each process.
      Returns:
      An array of integers representing the start times for each process.

    • isProcessInQueue

      public static boolean isProcessInQueue(int processIndex, int[] queue)
      This method is to check if a process with a specific index is present in the given process queue.
      Parameters:
      processIndex - The index of the process to check.
      queue - The array representing the process queue.
      Returns:
      True if the process is in the queue; otherwise, false.
